sen.j: 長尾神社（ながおじんじゃ）は、奈良県葛城市にある神社。
sen.e: Nagao-jinja Shrine is located in Katsuragi City, Nara Prefecture.
Nagao-jinja Shrine is located in Katsuragi City, Nara Prefecture.
Nagao-jinja Shrine is located in Katsuragi City, Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: 旧大和国葛下郡の式内社で、旧社格は郷社。
sen.e: It was a Shikinai-sha (shrine listed in Engishiki laws) of Katsuragi-gun, Yamato Province and was categorized as a gosha (a village shrine) in the old shrine ranking.
It was a Shikinai-sha (shrine listed in ancient Engishiki laws) of Katsuragi district, Yamato Province and was categorised as a gosha (village shrine) in the old shrine ranking.
It was a Shikinai-sha (shrine listed in ancient Engishiki laws) of Katsuragi district, Yamato Province and was categorised as a gosha (village shrine) in the old shrine ranking.
History ・ Summary
History and Summary
History and Summary

sen.j: このあたりを支配していた長尾氏の氏神とされるが定かでない。
sen.e: It is said to have been the guardian deity of the Nagao clan who governed this area, however, that is uncertain.
It is said to have housed the guardian deity of the Nagao clan who governed the area, however, this fact is unconfirmed.
sen.cmt: been the > housed the. that is uncertain > this fact is unconfirmed.
sen.e: It is said to have housed the guardian deity of the Nagao clan who governed the area, however, this fact is unconfirmed.

sen.j: また吉野連との関係があるとされる。
sen.e: It is also said to have been related to a family of Yoshinoren.
sen.cmt: 吉野連:定訳不明下記のHPによると一族の名前であるようなので、「吉野蓮一族」として訳してあります。http://yasaka.hp.infoseek.co.jp/nagaojinja.html
sen.e: It is also said to have been related to the Yoshinoren family.
It is also said to have been related to the Yoshinoren family.

sen.j: 鎮座地は竹内街道、長尾街道、横大路 (奈良県)が交差する交通の要衝であり、現在に至るまで交通安全祈願の神として祀られている。
sen.e: The shrine is located at the important traffic junction where Nagao-kaido Road and Yoko-oji Road (Nara Prefecture) intersect; and it has been enshrined as the god of traffic safety until today.
The shrine is located at the key junction where Nagao-kaido Road and Yoko-oji Road (Nara Prefecture) intersect and has been home to the god of traffic safety until today.
The shrine is located at the key junction where Nagao-kaido Road and Yoko-oji Road (Nara Prefecture) intersect and has been home to the god of traffic safety until today.

sen.j: 延喜式神名帳に「葛下郡長尾神社、大、月次、新嘗」と記されている。
sen.e: It is listed as a 'Nagao-jinja Shrine in Katsuragi-gun, taisya (a grand shrine), Tsukinami-sai festival, Niiname-sai festival (ceremonial offering by the Emperor of newly-harvested rice to the deities)' in the Engishiki jimmyocho (a register of shrines in Japan).
sen.cmt: 大:定訳不明「大社」と解釈して訳してあります。
sen.e: In the Engishiki jimmyocho (a register of shrines in Japan), it is listed as: 'A Nagao-jinja Shrine in Katsuragi-gun, taisya (a grand shrine), Tsukinami-sai festival, Niiname-sai festival (ceremonial offering by the Emperor of newly-harvested rice to the deities)'

In the Engishiki jimmyocho (a register of shrines in Japan), it is listed as: 'A Nagao-jinja Shrine in Katsuragi-gun, taisha (a grand shrine), Tsukinami-sai Festival, Niiname-sai Festival (ceremonial offering by the Emperor of newly-harvested rice to the deities)'
sen.cmt: 「taisya」を「taisha」に修正しました。「festival」を「Festival」に修正しました。

sen.e: Legend
Legend
Legend

sen.j: むかし、大和に大きなヘビが住み、三輪山を三重にとりまき、その尾は長尾までとどいた。
sen.e: A long time ago, there was a giant snake in Yamato Province; it curled three times around Mt. Miwa and its tail reached Nagao.
A long time ago, there was a giant snake in Yamato Province; it curled three times around Mt. Miwa and its tail reached Nagao.
A long time ago, there was a giant snake in Yamato Province; it curled three times around Mt. Miwa and its tail reached Nagao.

sen.j: 大神神社（桜井市）が頭で、長尾神社はその尾にあたると言われている。
sen.e: It is said that Omiwa-jinja Shrine (Sakurai City) was located at the head and Nagao-jinja Shrine was at the tail.
It is said that Omiwa-jinja Shrine (Sakurai City) was located at its head and Nagao-jinja Shrine at its tail.
sen.cmt: the >its. was at the > at its
sen.e: It is said that Omiwa-jinja Shrine (Sakurai City) was located at its head and Nagao-jinja Shrine at its tail.

sen.j: また、竜が住んでいたともされ、石園座多久虫玉神社（大和高田市）は竜の頭であり、長尾神社は竜の尾にあたるとされている。
sen.e: Moreover, it is also said that there was a dragon; and Iwazononiimasu-takumushitama-jinja Shrine (Yamatotakada City) was located at the head and Nagao-jinja Shrine was at the tail.
Moreover, it is also said that there was a dragon and Iwazononiimasu-takumushitama-jinja Shrine (Yamatotakada City) was located at its head and Nagao-jinja Shrine at its tail.
sen.cmt: the >its. was at the > at its
sen.e: Moreover, it is also said that there was a dragon and Iwazononiimasu-takumushitama-jinja Shrine (Yamatotakada City) was located at its head and Nagao-jinja Shrine at its tail.
